summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message about relationships and pride from Pastor Travis Hearn! In this incredible sermon, PT breaks down how pride can destroy our relationships and offers four key strategies to tear down those walls. Sometimes we don't realize how our own ego can sabotage our connections with others, right? Pastor Travis uses humor and deep biblical wisdom to show us that humility isn't weakness - it's actually our greatest strength. He challenges us to stop being know-it-alls, admit when we're wrong, ask for help, and continuously show grace and forgiveness. The sermon hits home with Jesus' teachings about not judging others while having a massive 'plank' in our own eye. Can you imagine how different our relationships would be if we approached them with true humility? PT reminds us that God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble, and that true love keeps no record of wrongs. This message isn't just about improving relationships - it's about transforming our hearts to look more like Christ's.

versesMentioned.text: Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails.
Every kingdom divided against itself will be laid waste, and every city or household divided against itself will not stand.
Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.

Do not judge, or you too will be judged. For in the same way you judge others, you will be judged, and with the measure you use, it will be measured to you. Why do you look at the speck of sawdust in your brother's eye and pay no attention to the plank in your own eye?
The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?
Whoever conceals their sins does not prosper, but the one who confesses and renounces them finds mercy.
Jesus said, 'Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.'
And being found in appearance as a man, he humbled himself by becoming obedient to death—even death on a cross!

Monday.scripture: Philippians 2:3: 'Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves.'
Monday.action: Make a list of your closest relationships. Reflect on recent interactions and honestly assess where pride might have hindered genuine connection. Write down specific moments where you chose being right over being loving.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal the areas of pride in my heart. Help me see my relationships through Your eyes of humility and love. Give me the courage to choose connection over being right. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: James 4:10: 'Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up.'
Tuesday.action: Intentionally ask someone close to you for advice or feedback. Listen without becoming defensive. Practice receiving their input with grace and openness.
Tuesday.prayer: God, teach me true humility. Help me be teachable and open to correction. Remove my defensiveness and help me grow through the wisdom of others. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 11:2: 'When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom.'
Wednesday.action: Journal about a recent conflict. Write from the other person's perspective. What might they have experienced? How can you take responsibility for your part?
Wednesday.prayer: Father, give me eyes to see beyond my own perspective. Help me understand others and grow in empathy and understanding. Reveal where I need to change. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Ephesians 4:2: 'Be completely humble and gentle; be patient, bearing with one another in love.'
Thursday.action: Choose one relationship where you struggle with patience. Intentionally respond with extra grace today. Pause before speaking and ask, 'How can I respond with love?'
Thursday.prayer: Lord, soften my heart. Help me respond to others with the same patience and grace You show me daily. Make me an instrument of Your love. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Colossians 3:12: 'Therefore, as God's chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness and patience.'
Friday.action: Perform an act of service for someone without seeking recognition. Do something kind anonymously or for someone who cannot repay you.
Friday.prayer: God, help me serve without expecting anything in return. Teach me true humility that seeks to bless others, not to be noticed. Use me as an instrument of Your love. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Proverbs 15:33: 'Wisdom's instruction is to fear the Lord, and humility comes before honor.'
Saturday.action: Review your week. Where did you see God working in your relationships? Where do you need to ask for forgiveness? Write a letter of gratitude to someone who has shown you grace.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, thank You for Your ongoing work in my heart. Help me continue to grow in humility, grace, and love. Reveal areas where I can become more like You. Amen.
